item.description: Update Trapped Vehicle; INC#0634; 10:40AM; 9200 N Tampa Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/45CWxfK; Northridge; CORRECTION: One patient was trapped with a total of three patients being transported (no further patient information available). LAPD Inc# 1470 ; FS 70; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC15 E104 E107 E296 E70 EM15 HR3 RA107 RA70 T96 UR88; CH8; 17; Margaret Stewart

Trapped Vehicle; INC#0634; 10:19AM; 9200 N Tampa Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/45CWxfK; Northridge; Two car collision with three total patients, two are trapped and require extrication. LAPD Inc# 1470; FS 70; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC15 E104 E107 E296 E70 EM15 HR3 RA107 RA70 T96 UR88; CH8; 17; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0575; 10:00AM; 6046 S 5th Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3FpGPd3; Hyde Park; KNOCKDOWN: 30 firefighters extinguished the fire in 12 minutes with no injuries reported. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E266 E294 E33 E57 E66 RA266 RA66 RA866 SQ21 T66 T94; CH7; 12; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0575; 09:48AM; 6046 S 5th Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3FpGPd3; Hyde Park; One story, single family dwelling with smoke showing. Firefighters are in the offensive mode and located fire in one room. All occupants are reported to be safely out of the home.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E266 E294 E33 E57 E66 RA266 RA66 RA866 SQ21 T66 T94; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart

Update Hazardous Materials; INC#0995; 06:12PM; 201 N Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/404etP9; Downtown; FINAL UPDATE: LAFD and LAPD, with support from outside agencies, conducted thorough and exhaustive testing of the contents in the area of the initial concern. No hazardous materials were located. The nearby office areas are cleared for repopulation. All LAFD and LAPD resources are recovering equipment and will be clearing the scene. Streets will be reopened for use within the hour. LAPD will continue to investigate the incident. ; FS 4; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 CE43 CM20 CM22 E203 E21 E4 EA1 EM1 JT4 RA21 RA3 RA4 RI200 SQ21 T3; CH7; 12; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1288; 04:55PM; 19609 W Sherman Wy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3M8eU53; Reseda; KNOCKDOWN: 29 firefighters extinguished the fire in 22 minutes. The two occupants of the unit escaped uninjured with their dog. Sadly, their cat was located deceased inside the unit. One patient from an adjacent unit is being evaluated (and likely transported) for an injury sustained during a fall while running from the unit. The fire was contained to the unit of origin. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 73; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E104 E273 E293 E305 E73 E93 RA73 RA872 RA93 T105 T73 T93; CH8; 17; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1288; 04:33PM; 19609 W Sherman Wy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3M8eU53; Reseda; Three story, garden style apartment building with smoke showing from one unit on the 2nd floor. Firefighters are in the offensive mode.; FS 73; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E104 E273 E293 E305 E73 RA73 RA872 RA93 T105 T73 T93; CH9; 17; Margaret Stewart

Update Traffic; INC#1215; 04:37PM; 5877 S Vermont Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3s3Dhdm; Vermont-Slauson; Total of four patients: three patients involved in the collision (adult female and a minor female) transported in unknown condition and one patient declined treatment/transport. The 4th patient was not involved in the collision but was on scene and requested LAFD transported for a medical complaint. There were no patients trapped or requiring extrication upon LAFD arrival. Any further questions are referred to LAPD Inc 2969 for the investigation.; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 E215 E221 E266 E57 E66 EM13 HR3 RA2 RA209 RA246 RA46 RA57 RA65 RA79 T15 T21 T66; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart

Traffic; INC#1215; 03:56PM; 5877 S Vermont Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3s3Dhdm; Vermont-Slauson; Vehicle into the front of a one story, commercial building. A total of three patients (age/gender/condition unknown) with no patients trapped or requiring extrication. The location of the patients (car vs pedestrians) is unknown at this time and all questions regarding the circumstances of the collision are referred to LAPD Inc# 2969 for the investigation. ; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 E215 E221 E266 E57 E66 EM13 HR3 RA2 RA46 RA57 RA65 RA79 T15 T21 T66; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart

Update Hazardous Materials; INC#0995; 04:05PM; 201 N Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/404etP9; Downtown; In a mailroom of the Los Angeles City Mall, two workers opened a package with concerning content. No substance was visible in the package. The two workers were evaluated by paramedics (did not have any signs or symptoms of illness) and transported to the hospital, as a precaution, for further evaluation. Out of an abundance of caution, these actions have/are taking place: 1) The mail room and a few adjacent businesses were evacuated by LAFD personnel; 2) The LAPD Bomb Squad is responding per protocol to further investigate other packages in the room. There is no active threat to City Hall, City Hall East or public safety. This response is a joint operation with LAFD and partner agencies including LAPD, FBI, and Postal Services. This type of incident will typically last several hours and drivers are advised to seek alternate routes. Los Angeles Street is closed between Temple & 1st. Media Staging: 1st St x Los Angeles St. ; FS 4; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E21 E4 EM1 JT4 RA21 RA3 RA4 SQ21; CH7; 12; Margaret Stewart
